subject.name: Design and Analysis of Algorithm
subject.description: Focuses on algorithmic strategies, asymptotic performance analysis, and algorithm design paradigms including divide-and-conquer, greedy, and dynamic programming. Covers tractable and intractable problems and introduces approximation and randomized algorithms.
objectives: Analyze the asymptotic performance of algorithms
Write rigorous correctness proofs for algorithms
Demonstrate familiarity with major algorithms and data structures
Apply important algorithmic design paradigms and methods of analysis
Synthesize efficient algorithms in common engineering design situations

units.title: Introduction and Analysis of Algorithms
topics: Asymptotic analysis of complexity bounds – best, average and worst-case behavior
Analysis of recursive algorithms using substitution, recursion tree, and master’s theorem

units.title: Fundamental Algorithmic Strategies
topics: Brute-force, greedy, dynamic programming, branch-and-bound, and backtracking methodologies
Applications of algorithmic design for problem-solving: bin packing, knapsack, traveling salesman problem

units.title: Graph and Tree Algorithms
topics: Traversal algorithms: Depth First Search (DFS) and Breadth First Search (BFS)

units.title: Tractable and Intractable Problems
topics: Computability of algorithms and computability classes – P, NP, NP-complete, and NP-hard
Standard NP-complete problems and reduction techniques

units.title: Advanced Topics
topics: Classes of problems beyond NP – PSPACE

suggested_books: Introduction to Algorithms, 4th Edition by Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, and Clifford Stein, MIT Press/McGraw-Hill
Fundamentals of Algorithms by E. Horowitz
Algorithm Design, 1st Edition by Jon Kleinberg and Éva Tardos, Pearson
Algorithm Design: Foundations, Analysis, and Internet Examples, 2nd Edition by Michael T. Goodrich and Roberto Tamassia, Wiley
Algorithms: A Creative Approach, 3rd Edition by Udi Manber, Addison-Wesley
